results.headline: Review: ‘She’s Funny That Way’ Offers Tomfoolery Amid the Floodlights
results.summary_short: Peter Bogdanovich’s first feature in more than a dozen years is a screwball comedy centered on a Broadway director and his circle.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of She's Funny That Way

results.headline: Review: Rupert Friend and Zachary Quinto in a Pas de Bullets, ‘Hitman: Agent 47’
results.summary_short: In Aleksander Bach’s revival of a franchise based on a video game, Mr. Friend plays the genetically engineered assassin-hero.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hitman: Agent 47

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Boy,’ an Unnerving 9-Year-Old Makes His Move
results.summary_short: Craig William Macneill’s film centers on a strange youngster who lives with his despondent, inattentive father in a crumbling motel.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Boy

results.headline: Review: In ‘Sinister 2,’ a Murderous Being Returns for More Mayhem
results.summary_short: In this horror sequel, a woman takes refuge in a rural home with her twin sons, who are then manipulated by evil.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sinister 2

results.headline: Review: In ‘American Ultra,’ Jesse Eisenberg Is a Stoner and a Target
results.summary_short: Kristen Stewart and Mr. Eisenberg pair up again in this film, an action adventure with C.I.A. trouble and occasional laughs.

results.headline: Review: Hapless Brothers and Their Lovers Intersect in ‘The Mend’
results.summary_short: Two brothers contend with girlfriends past and present in John Magary’s character-driven study of masculinity.

results.headline: Review: ‘Digging for Fire,’ a Comedy by Joe Swanberg
results.summary_short: While taking care of a client’s home, a couple whose marriage is already strained takes some time apart.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Digging for Fire

results.headline: Review: ‘Being Evel’ Examines the Life of a Notorious Stuntman
results.summary_short: Daniel Junge’s latest documentary traces Evel Knievel’s record-breaking (and bone-breaking) career.

results.headline: Review: A Despairing Librarian Is Ready to Check Out in ‘After Words’
results.summary_short: Romance is the last thing on the mind of Marcia Gay Harden’s character when she begins a tour of Costa Rica with a personal guide.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Grandma,’ Lily Tomlin Energizes an Intergenerational Road Trip
results.summary_short: Paul Weitz’s new film, centering on a feminist poet in her 70s and her granddaughter, is a comedy of conflict and solidarity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Grandma

results.headline: Review: In ‘Slow Learners,’ Aspirational Hedonists Doff Their Glasses
results.summary_short: This comedy stars Adam Pally and Sarah Burns as awkward schoolteachers who resolve to live on the wild side over summer break.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Slow Learners

results.headline: Review: ‘Beltracchi: The Art of Forgery’ Tells How a Swindler Fooled the World
results.summary_short: This film documents how Wolfgang Beltracchi became rich by mimicking the work of notable artists for decades until the authorities closed in.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Beltracchi: The Art of Forgery

results.headline: Review: ‘Brothers ... Blood Against Blood,’ Set in the Mean Streets of Mumbai
results.summary_short: This Bollywood movie, directed by Karan Malhotra, is dense with back story about two siblings who train for a mixed martial arts tournament.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brothers...Blood Against Blood

results.headline: Review: ‘We Come as Friends’ Explores Potential Exploitation of South Sudan
results.summary_short: Hubert Sauper’s documentary blends striking visuals with a pointed argument that outside investors seeking profits played a big role in the region’s independence movement.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of We Come as Friends

results.headline: Review: ‘Ten Thousand Saints,’ a Coming of Age in the East Village, Circa 1980s
results.summary_short: A troubled Vermont teenager is sent to live with his estranged father in New York and finds himself there during a defining cultural moment.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 10,000 Saints

results.headline: Review: ‘Rosenwald,’ on a Philanthropist Who Created Schools for Blacks in the Jim Crow South
results.summary_short: Aviva Kempner’s documentary offers a stirring portrait of a Sears executive whose Rosenwald Fund dispensed fellowships to black artists and academics including W. E. B. Du Bois and James Baldwin.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rosenwald

results.headline: Review: ‘Mistress America,’ a Noah Baumbach Comedy on Getting By in a Backbiting World
results.summary_short: This smart, fast-paced film, advertised as a screwball comedy, subverts this most buoyant of genres with a steady undertow of anxiety, dread and anger.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mistress America

results.headline: Review: ‘Meru’ Follows an Expedition Up Shark’s Fin Peak in the Himalayas
results.summary_short: This film about mountain climbers pokes at the psychology of extremity, zeroing in on push-the-limits personalities for whom calculating risk is a way of life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Meru

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tom at the Farm,’ Psychosexual Games Down at the Farm
results.summary_short: Xavier Dolan directs and stars in this film about a bereaved lover who discovers that his boyfriend’s family had no idea that he had a gay companion.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tom at the Farm

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Great Man,’ Friendship and Politics in a War Zone
results.summary_short: In this Sarah Leonor drama, two French soldiers’ lives change after a near-death experience in Afghanistan.
